docs.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Josh Beckett, facing surgery for a torn labrum in his left hip that caused him to miss most of the last three months of the season, retired at 34.
docs.abstract: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Josh Beckett, facing surgery for a torn labrum in his left hip that caused him to miss most of the last three months of 2014 season, retires.

docs.snippet: First baseman Eric Hosmer invited Royals fans to a local pub after leading the team to a sweep of the Angels....
docs.lead_paragraph: First baseman Eric Hosmer invited Royals fans to a local pub after leading the team to a sweep of the Angels.
docs.abstract: Kansas City Royals' first baseman Eric Hosmer, who missed most of August with a hand injury, has had a batting average of .500 through four playoff games, all Royals victories; after leading surging team to a sweep of Los Angeles Angels, Hosmer invited Royals fans via Twitter to celebrate with him at a downtown bar, where he helped pay for an open bar for an hour, even spraying some champagne into the crowd.

headline.main: Eric Hosmer and Teammates Extend Happy Hour After the Royals’ Sweep
headline.print_headline: Hosmer and Teammates Extend Happy Hour After the Royals’ Sweep

docs.snippet: Matt Carpenter had three homers and seven runs batted in as the Cardinals beat the Dodgers in an N.L. division series....
docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Carpenter had three homers and seven runs batted in as the Cardinals beat the Dodgers in an N.L. division series.
docs.abstract: St Louis Cardinals' Matt Carpenter is a big reason team has advanced to National League Championship Series, where they will face the San Francisco Giants; third baseman knocked in seven runs, with a bases-clearing double against Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw in Cardinals' 10-1 win in Game 1 of their NL division series.

headline.seo: Matt Carpenter's Batting Helped St. Louis Advance to N.L. Championship Series
headline.main: Lefty vs. Lefty? A Cardinal Thrives
headline.print_headline: Lefty vs. Lefty? A Cardinal Thrives

docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column holds that autumn has belonged to the San Francisco Giants, who are 11-1 in the postseason since Game 5 of the 2012 NLCS; they next face the St Louis Cardinals, another team with strong October performance.

headline.main: The San Francisco Giants Keep Stirring the Playoff Caldron
headline.print_headline: They Keep Stirring the Playoff Caldron
